information_requirement: Is an adversary attempting to gather detailed system and hardware information from our mobile devices? (PIR)

evidence.description: A mobile application exfiltrates a profile of the device's hardware and software configuration (e.g., OS version, device model, patch level) over the network shortly after installation or execution. This is often seen as a small data upload to an unusual or new domain.
evidence.nai: Corporate Wi-Fi network gateways and VPN concentrators
evidence.action: Monitor network egress points (Wi-Fi gateways, VPNs) using Zeek. For traffic originating from mobile device IP ranges, analyze http.log and ssl.log for connections to newly observed or known malicious domains. Correlate this with conn.log to identify small, infrequent data uploads (e.g., less than 5KB) which may represent device fingerprinting data being exfiltrated. Calculate the entropy of URI paths and query parameters; an unusually high entropy score for a GET or POST request from a non-standard application may indicate encoded system information. Flag devices exhibiting this behavior for further investigation.
